title: Exploring AI's Role in Accessibility
description: I met up with Jeremy Osborne and Andrew Miller to talk about the benefits and harms of AI as it relates to accessibility.

title: (De)coding Conventions
description: I spoke to hosts Neha Batra and Martin Woodward about AI’s potential to enhance accessibility and the projects leading the charge.

title: Microsoft AI for Accessibility
description: I spent some time talking to Kathryn of <cite>Assembling Inclusion</cite> about the Microsoft AI for Accessibility grant program, the different projects that have been funded, and the future direction of the program.

title: Progressive web apps with Aaron Gustafson
description: I joined Ben and Kaelan to talk about all things PWA.

title: Perspectives with Aaron Gustafson
description: I joined Luke and Jonathan to talk about the Open Web and share his perspective (and some guidance) with the WordPress community.

title: A Progressive View of the Web
description: I joined Jeff Veen to talk about PWAs, the importance of diversity & inclusion, and more.

title: From Progressive Enhancement to Progressive Web Apps
description: I joined Stephanie Cox to talk about a bunch of things, but mostly about making sure our sites work everywhere.

title: Progressive Web Apps - Pale Wheat Ale
description: Progressive Web Apps have been hailed as the next big leap forward in building web applications. In this episode we’re joined by Aaron Gustafson from Microsoft to talk all about PWAs and the future of the web.

title: WaSP and PWAs
description: Dave, Chris, and I talked at length about the Web Standards Project (WaSP), the web, and progressive web apps (PWAs).

title: Progressive Enhancement
description: I had a blast dispelling some misconceptions about progressive enhancement and discussing how to make this philosophy part of your workflow.

title: Content For All
description: It was such an honor to talk to Jason Ogle of User Defenders. I especially enjoyed discussing my biggest failure.

title: Web Accessibility
description: I talk about accessibility with Carl Franklin & Richard Campbell.

title: Progressive Enhancement Revisited
description: My rather lengthy chat with Emily Lewis & Lea Alcantara on progressive enhancement and all things web design.

title: NightHacking from Øredev
description: Fredrik and I talk about web standards, progressive enhancement, and more, live at Øredev.

title: Progressive Enhancement
description: Jen Simmons and I discuss working on the web and all things progressive enhancement.

title: Progressive Enhancement FTW
description: Jeffrey Zeldman and I discuss web design then and now; why Flipboard's 60fps web launch is anti-web and anti-user; Genesis's “Land of Confusion” video, and other bad ideas from the 1980s; design versus art; the demise and sendoff of Web Standards Sherpa; how the web community differs from other creative communities; and the 2nd Edition of my book, coming from New Riders this year.

title: Cross-device Adaptive Design
description: Jenn Lukas and I talked to Jared about responsive web design, progressive enhancement, and mobile in advance of our talk and workshop at UXIM in April.

title: The Accessibility of Web Forms
description: Giovanni DiFeterici & I discuss the accessibility of web forms and how we, as designers, can change the way things are done to create better experiences for our users.

title: Progressive Enhancement and Friends
description: Justin Avery and I chat about responsive design, element queries, progressive enhancement and dumb JavaScript.

title: Adaptive Web Design
description: From the vault, I sat down with the edUi folks to talk about what adaptive design is and why it’s important while I was at edUi 2013.

title: The State of Web Design
description: Josh Holmes and I chatted about the state of web design, progressive enhancement, and more.

title: Adaptive Web Design
description: Jim King and I chatted about adaptive design, the Chattanooga tech scene, and Web Standards Sherpa.

title: Adapting Your Designs
description: Jared Spool and I spent a bit of time chatting about progressive enhancement, responsive design, and more in this interview.

title: Progressive Enhancement
description: Lea Alcantara, Emily Lewis, and I talked about progressive enhancement, ExpressionEngine & more.

title: How to find the Right Web Services People
description: I joined the Small Business Roundtable to talk about hiring a web design firm.
